alert.note: Alert for Bath; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, southeastern Bath, Menifee, southwestern Rowan, north central Wolfe and southwestern Elliott Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 814 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ratlitt, or near Frenchburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Yale and Cogswell around 820 PM EDT. Scranton, Denniston, Bangor, Mariba and Zilpo around 825 PM EDT. Wellington, Dan, Korea, Big Woods, Artville, Paragon, Stoll and Pomeroyton around 830 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ebon, Kellacey, Ezel, Maytown, Omer, Twentysix, Dehart, Zag, Yocum, Blaze, Henry, Woodsbend, New Cummer, Grassy Creek, Pekin, Mize, Pomp, Murphyfork, West Liberty, Liberty Road, Licking River and Lick Branch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
